title: U.S. students who have used hallucinogenic drugs 2017
summary: This grouped bar chart represents 3 different Sexs on X-axis for 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of students.
Out of all 4 groups, Hispanic had the highest Share of students for Sex Male and Black (non-Hispanic) had the lowest Share of students for Sex Female.
Sex Male and Female had the biggest gap of 15.0 between the highest and lowest Share of students found for White (non-Hispanic).
Averaging all 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic, the Sex Male is the maximum Share of students and Female is the minimum Share of students.
min_summary: This grouped bar chart shows Share of students on the Y-axis for 3 different Sexs for 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic that are presented on the X-axis.
For Sex Male, Hispanic had the highest Share of students 82.0 among the 4 groups and in Female, Black (non-Hispanic) had the lowest Share of students 14.0.
mid_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 3 different Sexs on X-axis for 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of students.
Out of all 4 groups, Hispanic had the highest Share of students for Sex Male and Black (non-Hispanic) had the lowest Share of students for Sex Female.
Sex Male and Female had the biggest gap of 15.0 between the highest and lowest Share of students found for White (non-Hispanic).
Averaging all 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic, the Sex Male is the maximum Share of students and Female is the minimum Share of students.
max_summary: This grouped bar chart represents 3 different Sexs on X-axis for 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic. On the Y-axis it shows their corresponding Share of students.
For Sex Male, Hispanic had the highest Share of students 82.0 among the 4 groups and in Female, Black (non-Hispanic) had the lowest Share of students 14.0.
For Sex Male, White (non-Hispanic) had the maximum Share of students and it saw the lowest in Sex Female out of all 3 Sexs.
Sex Male and Female had the biggest gap of 15.0 between the highest and lowest Share of students found for White (non-Hispanic).
Among the groups, Black (non-Hispanic) had the biggest difference in Share of students. Where the maximum Share of students was 3.43 times larger than the minimum Share of students.

In case of Sex Male, Hispanic had the highest Share of students 82.0 among the 4 groups and in Female, Black (non-Hispanic) had the lowest Share of students 14.0. The second highest Share of students 76.0 was observed for Hispanic in Sex Male.
Averaging all 4 groups All races / ethnicities, White (non-Hispanic), Black (non-Hispanic), and Hispanic, the Sex Male is the maximum Share of students and Female is the minimum Share of students.
